item_prototype.name: Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Check connection
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Check version
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Databases List
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Database {$PGSQL_DATABASE_NAME}: active connections
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Database {$PGSQL_DATABASE_NAME}: database size
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Database {$PGSQL_DATABASE_NAME}: tuples deletes /s
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Database {$PGSQL_DATABASE_NAME}: tuples fetches /s
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Database {$PGSQL_DATABASE_NAME}: tuples inserts /s
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Database {$PGSQL_DATABASE_NAME}: tuples updates /s
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Total number of checkpoints launched by timeout /s
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Total number of checkpoints requests /s
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Total number of commits /s
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Total number of rollbacks /s
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME}: Total number of server processes
Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME} Locks: Total number of Access Exclusive Locks /s
item_prototype.description:
Conflicts with locks of all modes (ACCESS SHARE, ROW SHARE, ROW EXCLUSIVE, SHARE UPDATE EXCLUSIVE, SHARE, SHARE ROW EXCLUSIVE, EXCLUSIVE, and ACCESS EXCLUSIVE). This mode guarantees that the holder is the only transaction accessing the table in any way.
Acquired by the ALTER TABLE, DROP TABLE, REINDEX, CLUSTER, and VACUUM FULL commands. This is also the default lock mode for LOCK TABLE statements that do not specify a mode explicitly.

item_prototype.name: Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME} Locks: Total number of Access Shared Locks /s
item_prototype.description:
Conflicts with the ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock mode only.
The commands SELECT and ANALYZE acquire a lock of this mode on referenced tables. In general, any query that only reads a table and does not modify it will acquire this lock mode.

item_prototype.name: Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME} Locks: Total number of Exclusive Locks /s
item_prototype.description:
Conflicts with the ROW SHARE, ROW EXCLUSIVE, SHARE UPDATE EXCLUSIVE, SHARE, SHARE ROW EXCLUSIVE, EXCLUSIVE, and ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock modes. This mode allows only concurrent ACCESS SHARE locks, i.e., only reads from the table can proceed in parallel with a transaction holding this lock mode.
This lock mode is not automatically acquired by any PostgreSQL command.

item_prototype.name: Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME} Locks: Total number of Row Exclusive Locks /s
item_prototype.description:
Conflicts with the SHARE, SHARE ROW EXCLUSIVE, EXCLUSIVE, and ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock modes.
The commands UPDATE, DELETE, and INSERT acquire this lock mode on the target table (in addition to ACCESS SHARE locks on any other referenced tables). In general, this lock mode will be acquired by any command that modifies the data in a table.

item_prototype.name: Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME} Locks: Total number of Row Shared Locks /s
item_prototype.description:
Conflicts with the EXCLUSIVE and ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock modes.
The SELECT FOR UPDATE command acquires a lock of this mode on the target table(s) (in addition to ACCESS SHARE locks on any other tables that are referenced but not selected FOR UPDATE).

item_prototype.name: Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME} Locks: Total number of Shared Locks /s
item_prototype.description:
Conflicts with the ROW EXCLUSIVE, SHARE UPDATE EXCLUSIVE, SHARE ROW EXCLUSIVE, EXCLUSIVE, and ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock modes. This mode protects a table against concurrent data changes.
Acquired by CREATE INDEX.

item_prototype.name: Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME} Locks: Total number of Shared Row Exclusive Locks /s
item_prototype.description:
Conflicts with the ROW EXCLUSIVE, SHARE UPDATE EXCLUSIVE, SHARE, SHARE ROW EXCLUSIVE, EXCLUSIVE, and ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock modes.
This lock mode is not automatically acquired by any PostgreSQL command.

item_prototype.name: Instance {#PGSQL_INSTANCE_NAME} Locks: Total number of Shared Update Exclusive Locks /s
item_prototype.description:
Conflicts with the SHARE UPDATE EXCLUSIVE, SHARE, SHARE ROW EXCLUSIVE, EXCLUSIVE, and ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock modes. This mode protects a table against concurrent schema changes and VACUUM runs.
Acquired by VACUUM (without FULL).
